text:
Hey guys it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

It’s the holiday season and I got so many
requests from you guys to do

something Minecraft Related, so I thought
hmmmm, what about some Coal Cookies?

Because coal is a very popular mineral that
you use in Minecraft,
and I thought, perfect!

Alright, so today we are gonna be making Minecraft
Coal Cookies!
Let’s get started!

I love this recipe because it’s super easy
and fun, and I love

making cookies over the holidays. So this
is a very unique cookie,
it’s really cool!

The things you will need, will be: A blender,
2 packages of Oreos,

1 sh-tick of butter, which is about 1/2 a
cup of butter,

a mixing bowl, 2 bags of mini marshmallows,
a piece of parchment paper,

a butter knife, a stove pot, wooden spoon,
cooking spray, and, a
9x13 baking pan. Let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is gut
our Oreos.

To do this you just take your cookie, twist
it in half, and I like to use

a little butter knife to take out all of the
yummy filling.

And then we’re gonna put the full chocolate
cookie into the big mixing bowl,

This is a job that’s fun to do with friend
because it will move a lot faster!

And you’re just gonna do this to all of
the Oreos.

Just finished scraping all of our Oreos, look
at all of ‘em!
Dee-dee-dee-dee-dee!

They’re ready to go! The next thing that
we’re gonna do is we are gonna crush up our

Oreos in a blender, if you don’t have a
blender you can use a food processor,

or if you don’t have either, you can put
these in a little bag and crush
‘em up with a rolling pin, just, old school!
Put a bunch of ‘em in here, oh here we go!
This is a little faster. Oh, oh, oh!
Hmm-hmm-hmm-hmm!
Just pack it down…
And grind!

And then we’re just gonna keep grinding
up all of our cookies.

Oh my gosh you guys… Oh that smells like
a Oreo!
Oh yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum!

OK, focus Ro! These are all ground up, I’m
gonna put them right over

here, and before we head over to the stove
I’m gonna prep our baking pan,

it’s really easy, here I’ve just got some
baking spray.
I’m just gonna spray the pan. Doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!

And now, we are gonna take our crushed Oreos,
marshmallows, butter and
our pot, over to the stove.

Turn your stove heat onto medium-low. Then
add your butter and stir

until the butter melts. Now, add your marshmallows
and continue to heat

and stir consistently until the marshmallows
have completely melted.

Once melted, turn off the stove heat and add
in your crushed cookies,
and stir until well combined.

Our Coal cookie mixture is fresh off the stove,
it’s very hot, so be careful,

and you’re gonna want to pour it immediately
into your baking pan.

Now you’re gonna take your spoon, spread
it out while it’s still warm.

It’s a little bit lumpy on the top, but
it looks like coal, it’s so cool!

Now you’re gonna let it set out at room
temperature for about 30 minutes

to set. Our coal cookie mix has had plenty
of time to set, over here

I have a piece of parchment paper, which I
have taped down onto a cutting

board, I got a sharp cutting knife, be careful,
and I’m just going to
cut, basically little brownie bites.

I’m just gonna pick ‘em up, and transfer
‘em over here.

Once your coal cookie squares are all cut
out, what you can do, it’s totally

optional, I like to do this. Is I just gave
them a few pinches,

pinch-pinch-pinch, to shape them so they look
more like a little lump of coal.

And then over here I have a little serving
plate, ahhhh!

Because I’m gonna be sharing these with
some friends later.

So I’m just gonna transfer them over here
onto the serving plate,
and then they’re ready to enjoy!
Ta-da!

Here are the Minecraft themed Coal Cookies
that we made for the Holidays!

A big thank you to you guys for suggesting
something Minecraft!

And, I love these, these are so easy to make,
so yummy!

I’ll be posting lots of pictures on Facebook,
Tumblr, Twitter
and Instagram!

And if you guys make these, please take a
picture and send it to me.

I love seeing your baking creations! It just
makes my day!

I hope you guys are having a good holiday
season, and if you have

any other ideas for any other Nerdy Nummies
that I should make,

please let me know, leave me a comment down
below and I will do my best
to make it happen!
Thank you, you guys, bye-bye!
Ro: Cheers! Happy Holidays!
All: Mmmm!
All: Bye!
